title: Brown Butter Chocolate Chip Cookie Cake
directions: Preheat oven to 325F. Grease a 10-inch cookie cake pan and line the bottom with parchment paper.
Whisk together flour, baking powder, and baking soda in a bowl.

Slice butter into four pieces and melt 8 tbsp (113g) in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the butter until dark golden with nutty aroma (2-3 minutes). Pour into a large bowl with the remaining 4 tbsp butter and stir until all butter is melted and combined.

Stir in both sugars, vanilla, and salt with a rubber spatula until combined. Whisk in the egg and yolk until smooth and glossy (about 45 seconds). Let batter sit for 2-3 minutes, then whisk again for 45 seconds.
Pour flour mixture into the bowl and use a spatula to combine until all dry ingredients are incorporated. Place chopped chocolate over the dough and knead until evenly distributed.
Weigh out about 650g of dough and press evenly into the prepared pan to about 3/4 to 1 inch thick. Freeze any remaining dough in cookie-sized scoops for later.
Bake at 325F for 25-35 minutes. For gooey center, pull when center is just set and slightly jiggly. For firmer, sliceable cake, bake until a toothpick comes out with just a few moist crumbs.
Let cool in the pan for at least 15-20 minutes before removing. Sprinkle with flaky sea salt while still warm.
notes: This recipe is adapted from a brown butter chocolate chip cookie recipe for a 10-inch cookie cake. Bake at 325F (not the cookie recipe's 350F) to ensure the center cooks without overbrowning the edges. Total dough makes about 900g - use 650g for the pan and freeze the rest as individual cookies. The dough should be about 3/4 to 1 inch thick before baking. Run a thin knife around the edges before removing from pan. For overnight storage, wrap tightly to keep soft and gooey.
